p: Nanoemulsion (NE) of the essential oil from X. ochrantha leaves exhibited molluscicidal activity against adult (size of 10-12 mm) B. glabrata (Sumidouro, RJ) with LC 50/24 h = 50.91 ± 3.06 ppm, LC 90/24 h = 85.46 ± 4.96 ppm, LC 50/48 h = 47.41 ± 2.85 ppm, and LC 90/48 h = 78.48 ± 4.35 ppm. Furthermore, in the complementary assay with B. glabrata (Ressaca, MG), NE was tested at three concentrations 32, 47, and 78 ppm. Among juvenile molluscs with a size of 3-5 mm, 96.7% and 100% mortality was observed at the concentrations of 47 ppm (LC 90/48 h) and 78 ppm (LC 50/48 h), respectively, within 24 h. The NE could cause a higher mortality rate among adults of size 6-7 mm (100% at the concentration of 47 ppm). When it was used at a concentration of 32 ppm, the NE caused mortality in 96.7% adults from this region. Adult molluscs (between 8-10 mm) were affected to a lesser extent, exhibiting mortality of 3.3% in 24 h at the concentration of 47 ppm ( Table III).
